description: Occurs when a page (screen) is displayed within a pager (specific to Scenes).

app_defined_id.description: An identifier defined by the application if the in-app pager was created by the application logic, not Airship. If this field is present, the event body will not contain `push_id`, `group_id`, `variant_id`, or `triggering_push` fields.

completed.description: True if the user reached the end of the pager.

context.description: The context provides the view state when a button, pager, or form interaction occurs.

reporting_context.description: Describes the content types of the in-app automation. Can be expanded to provide any data for reporting.

state.description: Can contain the current view state of pager and form.

submitted.description: True if the form has been submitted.

completed.description: True if the user reached the end of the pager.

context.title: In-app context

group_id.description: Identifies a push specification delivered over an interval of time, e.g., multiple push_ids as part of the fulfillment of an automation pipeline or a push-to-local-time specification.
group_id.title: Group ID

locale.description: Optional string that defines the country and language this in-app-automation was localized as by remote-config-api. `country` - (String) An ISO 3166-1 country code, set by device settings. `language` - (String) The ISO 639-1 two-letter language code reflecting the language the phone is set to.

push_id.description: A unique identifier for a push operation.
push_id.title: Push ID

session_id.description: Represents the "session" of user activity. Absent if the application was initialized while backgrounded.
session_id.title: Session ID

time_sent.description: An ISO 8601 date-time indicating when the payload defining the in-app message was sent to the device. May be absent.

triggering_push.description:
The specific `push_id` and accompanying identifiers associated with an event. An associated push helps you trace an event to the original notification or operation.

An associated push object may specify a `time`, if the push was a singular operation sent at a defined time. Otherwise, the object will include a `group_id` if the push was sent at a relative time (`best_time` or `local_time`) an automation pipeline, or another operation resulting in multiple `push_id`s.

campaigns.description: An object listing the campaigns a push specification is associated with. The campaigns object includes an array of categories that must have between 1 and 10 elements, each of which is a string with a 64-byte and -character limit.
campaigns.title: Campaigns Object

group_id.description: Identifies a push specification delivered over an interval of time, e.g., multiple push_ids as part of the fulfillment of an automation pipeline or a push-to-local-time specification.
group_id.title: Group ID

push_id.description: A unique identifier for a push operation.
push_id.title: Push ID

time.description: The UTC time when the push occurred.

variant_id.description: The ID of the variant that a push is associated with, if the push was a part of an A/B test (experiment).
variant_id.title: Variant ID

triggering_push.title: Associated push

viewed_count.description: Number of times the current page has been viewed.

device.description: Information about app users generated by the SDK.

amazon_channel.description: The identifier for a Fire OS channel. In general, this is also the same value as the `channel`.

android_channel.description: The identifier for an Android channel. In general, this is also the same value as the `channel`.

app_package_name.description: A unique identifier for the app name.

background_push_enabled.description: Indicates whether or not the device has background push notifications enabled.

carrier.description: The wireless carrier used by the device. **Deprecation notice:** This property will not be collected as of SDK 20 for both iOS and Android and will be removed on October 8, 2025.

connection_type.description: The internet connection type used by the device. **Deprecation notice:** This property will not be collected as of SDK 20 for both iOS and Android and will be removed on October 8, 2025.

iana_timezone.description: The time zone of the device.

locale_country_code.description: The ISO 3166-1 country code as defined in device settings.

locale_language_code.description: The ISO 639-1 two-letter language code reflecting the language that the device is set to.

locale_timezone.description: The device's time zone offset in seconds from UTC.

location_enabled.description: Indicates whether or not the device has location services enabled.

location_permission.description:
* `SYSTEM_LOCATION_DISABLED` Location is disabled in system settings
* `NOT_ALLOWED` Android: missing manifest permissions, iOS: opted out
* `ALWAYS_ALLOWED` Android: has manifest permissions, iOS: opted in background and foreground
* `FOREGROUND_ALLOWED` iOS only: opted in foreground only
* `UNPROMPTED`: iOS only

push_opt_in.description: Indicates whether or not the device is opted into push notifications.

ua_sdk_version.description: The version of the Airship SDK used in the app.

channel.description: The unique, platform-agnostic channel identifier for a device.

device_type.description: The platform that the channel is on.

identifiers.description: Identifying information specific to app devices.

com.urbanairship.limited_ad_tracking_ena.description: If true, the user has enabled limited ad tracking.

ios_channel.description: The identifier for an iOS channel. In general, this is also the same value as the `channel`.

named_user_id.description: The Named User identifier for the device.

device.title: App device information

id.description: Uniquely identifies an event. The data stream will occasionally send duplicate events. Duplicate events will have the same `id`, `type`, `occurred`, `device`, and `body` values but different `offset` and `processed` values. You should use the `id` to deduplicate.

offset.description: An identifier of a location in the stream; used to resume the stream after severing a connection. If you open a stream using the offset value, the stream will resume with the next element in the stream. You should store this value as a string so that you can easily resume the stream if it ends for any reason.

processed.description: When the event was ingested by Airship. There may be some latency between when the event occurred, and when it was processed.

user.description: The current state of the user when the event is emitted, including the contact ID and an optional named user ID.

contact_id.description: The Contact identifier for the device.

named_user_id.description: The Named User identifier for the device.

user.title: User

title: In-app page view
